Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio D Hodges was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek/maintain full time employment/education per agent

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent. Not to operate m/v w/o valid DL.   Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  Absolute Sobriety.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antonio D Hodges in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty O'Rourke states agreement.  Says DE will waive his right to PSI.  DE agrees.  State is in agreement.  Atty O'Rourke enters NC plea to Ct 1.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  State makes statement.  Atty O'Rourke makes statement.  DE makes statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  DE advised of voting rights and felony firearms warnings.

Ct 1:  NC - w/o alcohol fine enhancer
5 years prison (2 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision) to commence FORTHWITH
ERP/SAP/CIP are all approved
4 days credit to be applied
Fine/costs of $1474.00 and $25.00 blood draw fee to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
AODA
Revoke DL 36 months
IID for 36 months effective upon licensure
Conditions of extended supervision:
Absoute sobriety at all times
No bars/taverns/liquor stores 
Seek/maintain full-time employment/education per agent
Not to operate MV w/o valid DL
Counseling/treatment/AODA per agent
DNA sample to be provided
Cash bond to be applied and balance refunded to the poster
